de.psi.efload.packerapi
Interface IntegralPacker

All Known Implementing Classes:
IMLIntegralPacker
public interface IntegralPacker

Defines the interface of a packing algorithm that constructs a loading plan for a complete tour. The contract between the packer and its caller includes the following clauses:

  • The packer is responsible for the spatial arrangement of packages in a number of containers with the specified types.
  • The packer is called during after construction of a tour that consists of a sequence of loading and unloading events.
  • The packer is stateless, i.e. there is no intrinsic connection between successive calls to createLoadingPlan.
  • The caller delivers the transports in a sorted array.
  • The packer may pack only a fraction of the packages of a transport if the transport is marked as dividable. In this case the transport is divided and the remainder is returned with the loading result.
  • The packer may throw a RuntimeException if it detects a violation of this contract.
  • The packer delivers either a legal loading plan that contains at least one package for each transport or no loading plan at all.
  • If the packer delivers no loading plan at all the input transports are unchanged.

Author:
kschroeder

Method Summary
 LoadingResult createLoadingPlan(TourTransport[] transports, ContainerType[] containerTypes)
          Tries to load the packages specified by the transports into the specified container.
 

Method Detail

createLoadingPlan

LoadingResult createLoadingPlan(TourTransport[] transports,
                                ContainerType[] containerTypes)
Tries to load the packages specified by the transports into the specified container.

Parameters:
transports - Defines the packages together with their loading and unloading locations. The array is primarily sorted by ascending loading locations and a secondarily by ascending unloading locations. The locations are numbered consecutively along the route beginning with zero for the first loading location.
containerTypes - The types of the containers into which the packages are to be loaded. The index into this array is used to identify the container in the loading plan, see Package.getContainerIndex().
Returns:
null on failure or the result containing the new loading plan on success.
